actor_awards.notes: Born Charles Buchinsky, he became the archetype of the tough guy in cinema. He won the Golden Globe Henrietta Award for World Film Favorite in 1972. He was a top box office draw in the 1970s.

filmography.title: Once Upon a Time in the West
filmography.role_description: A mysterious, harmonica-playing gunslinger seeking revenge against a ruthless killer.
filmography.plot: A mysterious stranger with a harmonica joins forces with a desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.

filmography.title: The Great Escape
filmography.role_description: A Polish RAF flight lieutenant and expert tunnel digger who suffers from claustrophobia.
filmography.plot: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Magnificent Seven
filmography.role_description: A gunfighter of Irish-Mexican heritage who bonds with the village children while defending their town.
filmography.plot: Seven gunfighters are hired by Mexican peasants to liberate their village from oppressive bandits.

filmography.title: Death Wish
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered architect who becomes a vigilante after his wife is murdered and his daughter assaulted.
filmography.plot: A New York City architect becomes a one-man vigilante squad after his wife is murdered by street punks.

filmography.title: The Dirty Dozen
filmography.role_description: A quiet, Polish-American convict who is selected for a suicide mission due to his ability to speak German.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a rebellious U.S. Army Major is assigned a dozen convicted murderers to train and lead them into a mass assassination mission of German officers.

filmography.title: Hard Times
filmography.role_description: A drifter and bare-knuckle street fighter trying to make some money during the Great Depression.
filmography.plot: In the Depression, a drifter and a gambler team up to make money in illegal bare-knuckle fighting.

filmography.title: Mr. Majestyk
filmography.role_description: A melon farmer and Vietnam veteran who refuses to be intimidated by the local mob.
filmography.plot: A melon farmer battles organized crime and a hitman who wants to kill him.

filmography.title: The Mechanic
filmography.role_description: An aging hitman who takes on a young apprentice, unaware of the apprentice's connection to one of his hits.
filmography.plot: An aging hitman befriends a young man who wants to be a professional killer. Eventually it becomes clear that someone has betrayed them.

filmography.title: House of Wax
filmography.role_description: A mute sculptor and henchman to the villainous Professor Jarrod. (Credited as Charles Buchinsky)
filmography.plot: A wax sculptor's partner burns down his museum to collect the insurance, but the sculptor survives and seeks revenge.

filmography.title: Red Sun
filmography.role_description: A robber who is betrayed by his partner and teams up with a samurai to recover a stolen gold sword.
filmography.plot: A samurai and a gunslinger team up to recover a stolen sword and find the gunslinger's double-crossing partner.

filmography.title: Chato's Land
filmography.role_description: A half-Apache man who is hunted by a posse of white men and uses the land to turn the tables on them.
filmography.plot: A half-Apache man kills a sheriff in self-defense and is hunted by a posse through the desert.

filmography.title: Breakheart Pass
filmography.role_description: A prisoner on a train who is actually a secret agent investigating a conspiracy.
filmography.plot: A train full of supplies and soldiers is heading to a fort in the West, but a murder and a conspiracy threaten the journey.

filmography.title: The Valachi Papers
filmography.role_description: The first Mafia member to publicly acknowledge the existence of the Cosa Nostra.
filmography.plot: The true story of Joe Valachi, a Mafia member who turns informant to save his own life.

filmography.title: Telefon
filmography.role_description: A KGB agent sent to the US to stop a rogue element from activating deep-sleeper agents.
filmography.plot: A Russian KGB agent travels to the United States to stop a madman from activating brainwashed saboteurs.

filmography.title: Rider on the Rain
filmography.role_description: An American investigator in France who relentlessly pursues a woman who killed her rapist.
filmography.plot: A woman kills a rapist and disposes of the body, but a mysterious American investigator arrives and seems to know everything.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win - Best Foreign-Language Foreign Film

filmography.title: Machine-Gun Kelly
filmography.role_description: His first leading role as the notorious depression-era gangster.
filmography.plot: The story of the famous bank robber and kidnapper, Machine Gun Kelly, and his downfall.

filmography.title: 10 to Midnight
filmography.role_description: A veteran police detective who plants evidence to catch a slippery serial killer.
filmography.plot: A police detective goes to extreme lengths to stop a serial killer who exploits legal loopholes.

filmography.title: Death Hunt
filmography.role_description: A reclusive trapper in the Yukon who is relentlessly pursued by a Mountie after a dispute.
filmography.plot: In 1931 Canada, a trapper is accused of murder and pursued across the frozen wilderness by the RCMP.

filmography.title: Breakout
filmography.role_description: A bush pilot hired to break an American out of a Mexican prison.
filmography.plot: A pilot is hired to rescue an American businessman who has been framed and imprisoned in Mexico.

filmography.title: The White Buffalo
filmography.role_description: A haunting portrayal of the legendary gunfighter who hunts a mythical beast.
filmography.plot: Wild Bill Hickok and Crazy Horse team up to hunt a legendary white buffalo.

filmography.title: Jubal
filmography.role_description: A drifting cowboy who befriends the protagonist and helps him against a jealous ranch hand.
filmography.plot: A rancher's wife takes a liking to a new cowhand, causing jealousy in the foreman and the rancher.

filmography.title: From Noon Till Three
filmography.role_description: A superstitious outlaw who has a brief romance that becomes exaggerated into a legend.
filmography.plot: An outlaw has a brief tryst with a widow, which is later romanticized into a legendary love story in a bestselling book.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination - Best Original Song

filmography.title: Violent City
filmography.role_description: A professional hitman who seeks revenge against those who betrayed him.
filmography.plot: A professional hitman is betrayed by his girlfriend and boss, survives an assassination attempt, and plots his revenge.

filmography.title: Battle of the Bulge
filmography.role_description: An American intelligence officer dealing with the German offensive.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of Nazi Germany's final Western Front counterattack of World War II.

filmography.title: The Indian Runner
filmography.role_description: The grieving father of two disparate brothers in this Sean Penn-directed drama.
filmography.plot: Two brothers, a Vietnam vet and a cop, struggle to deal with their differences and their demons.

filmography.title: Vera Cruz
filmography.role_description: A greedy mercenary working alongside Burt Lancaster and Gary Cooper.
filmography.plot: During the Mexican Rebellion of 1866, an American mercenary and an outlaw are hired to escort a countess to Vera Cruz.

filmography.title: Cold Sweat
filmography.role_description: An American expat in France whose criminal past catches up with him.
filmography.plot: A man living a quiet life in France is forced to use his skills as a former getaway driver when his family is threatened by old associates.
